dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Nearly half of the country's major cities, like twenty out of forty-one, have seen their populations actually shrink.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nearly half of the country's major cities, like twenty out of forty-one, have seen their populations actually shrink.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In nearly half of Kazakhstan's major cities, a decrease in population has been recorded. According to the latest estimate by the National Statistics Bureau, a population decline was noted in 20 out of 41 cities of republican and regional significance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Konayev had the biggest drop, um, an 8.2 percent decrease in just one year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Konayev had the biggest drop, um, an eight point two percent decrease in just one year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Data Hub, the greatest decrease in population was observed in Konayev, with a drop of 8.2% over the past year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That brings it down to 65,900 people. And Semey lost over five percent of its population too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That brings it down to sixty five thousand, nine hundred people. And Semey lost over five percent of its population too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of April 1, the city has 65,900 residents. A significant decrease is also seen in Semey, with a decline of 5.1%, down to 314,100 people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is significant because that's a much larger city, you know, down to 314,100 residents.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is significant because that's a much larger city, you know, down to three hundred fourteen thousand, one hundred residents.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A significant decrease is also seen in Semey, with a decline of 5.1%, down to 314,100 people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Baikonur is third on that list with a 3.6 percent decline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Baikonur is third on that list with a three point six percent decline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closing the top three in the "anti-rating" is Baikonur, where the population decreased by 3.6%, totaling 32,400 residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the report suggests Konayev's drop might be a correction after it became the administrative center for Almaty region back in 2022.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the report suggests Konayev's drop might be a correction after it became the administrative center for Almaty region back in twenty twenty two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the decline in Semey and Baikonur has been steadily observed over the past five years, in Konayev, the population decrease is seen as a correction after a sharp increase following the city's transformation into the administrative center of Almaty region in 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it had a sharp increase before this recent decline. Meanwhile, other cities saw much smaller than two percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it had a sharp increase before this recent decline. Meanwhile, other cities saw much smaller than two percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Konayev, the population decrease is seen as a correction after a sharp increase following the city's transformation into the administrative center of Almaty region in 2022. In the other cities, the population decline does not exceed 2%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Except for a few like Priozersk and Kurchatov, where the decrease was a bit higher, around two point something percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Except for a few like Priozersk and Kurchatov, where the decrease was a bit higher, around two point something percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Exceptions include Priozersk, Kurchatov, and Arkalyk, where the decrease ranged from 2.3% to 2.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not all decline. Kossy, which only became a city in 2021, grew by over eight percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not all decline. Kossy, which only became a city in twenty twenty one, grew by over eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The greatest relative population increase was recorded in the city of Kossy, located 20 kilometers from Astana. Over the past year, the population here grew by 8.3%, reaching 61,500 people. It should be noted that Kossy was granted city status in July 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's huge growth! It's now at 61,500 people and it's really close to Astana.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's huge growth! It's now at sixty one thousand, five hundred people and it's really close to Astana.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The greatest relative population increase was recorded in the city of Kossy, located 20 kilometers from Astana. Over the past year, the population here grew by 8.3%, reaching 61,500 people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of Astana, the capital itself grew by almost seven percent to 1.55 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of Astana, the capital itself grew by almost seven percent to one point five five million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In second place is Astana, with a population growth of 6.9%. As of April 1, 2025, the capital has 1.55 million residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Almaty and Shymkent both grew by 2.7 percent each, which is still pretty solid for such large cities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Almaty and Shymkent both grew by two point seven percent each, which is still pretty solid for such large cities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almaty showed a population growth of 2.7%. Shymkent also experienced a growth rate of 2.7%, bringing its population to 1.26 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So you've got this real splitâ€”smaller regional centers shrinking while the big hubs and new satellite cities are booming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So you've got this real split-smaller regional centers shrinking while the big hubs and new satellite cities are booming.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It paints a clear picture of internal migration trends, people moving towards opportunity and economic centers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It paints a clear picture of internal migration trends, people moving towards opportunity and economic centers.
